citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
Female Shih-Tzu, DOB 7/1/2018 (tag #10) has her left upper cheek tooth that is loose to the touch. Each of her upper
cheek also are covered in plaque material. A tooth that is loose to the touch and teeth covered in plaque material is a sign
of dental disease and can cause health problems and discomfort for the dog. This condition was pointed out to the
licensee. Ensure to have this dog seen by the veterinarian and then develop a method of daily observations that will help
detect problems including dental health problems.
***Correct by June 26, 2023.

It has been more than 12 months since the last physical exams on adult dogs were done at the facility by the attending
veterinarian. A complete head to tail physical exam is required at least once yearly to help ensure each dog is healthy.
Ensure that each dog gets a physical exam completed by the attending veterinarian.
***Correct by August 12, 2023.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
n

narrative:
2.40(b)(3) 
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
Female Shih-Tzu, DOB 7/1/2018 (tag #10) has her left upper cheek tooth that is loose to the touch. Each of her upper 
cheek also are covered in plaque material. A tooth that is loose to the touch and teeth covered in plaque material is a sign 
of dental disease and can cause health problems and discomfort for the dog. This condition was pointed out to the 
licensee. Ensure to have this dog seen by the veterinarian and then develop a method of daily observations that will help 
detect problems including dental health problems. 
***Correct by June 26, 2023. 
3.13(a)(2) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
It has been more than 12 months since the last physical exams on adult dogs were done at the facility by the attending 
veterinarian. A complete head to tail physical exam is required at least once yearly to help ensure each dog is healthy. 
Ensure that each dog gets a physical exam completed by the attending veterinarian. 
***Correct by August 12, 2023. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative. 
 
 n
